lead_paragraph: AS advances in technology bring into question basic assumptions about life and death, medical and legal scholars are suggesting that motherhood may in the future be defined less in terms of biology than in terms of intent. The biological definition of motherhood lost a good deal of its certainty late last month with a court decision and the announcement of a medical advance that presented contrasting new versions of this elemental concept.

headline.main: Ideas & Trends; Science and the Courts Take a New Look at Motherhood
